# New Taipei Kings

| history       = New Taipei Kings2021–2024 (PLG)2024–present (TPBL)

| capacity      = 6,800

| gm            = James Mao

| affiliation   =
| championships = 2PLG: 1 (2024)TPBL: 1 (2025)
| ret_nums      = 1 (7)
| website       =
}}
New Taipei Kings () are a Taiwanese professional basketball team based in New Taipei City. They have competed in the Taiwan Professional Basketball League (TPBL) and play their home games at the Xinzhuang Gymnasium and University of Taipei, Tian-Mu Campus Gymnasium. The Kings joined the P. League+ since the 2021–22 season, and became one of the seven teams of the inaugural TPBL season. The Kings also participated in the East Asia Super League (EASL) since the 2023–24 season and Basketball Champions League Asia (BCL Asia) since 2025.
Franchise history
On July 9, 2024, the New Taipei Kings announced to join the Taiwan Professional Basketball League (TPBL).
On June 29, 2025, the New Taipei Kings defeated the Kaohsiung Aquas, 4–3, winning the 2024–25 season championship. On July 24, the New Taipei Kings were invited to participate in 2025–26 East Asia Super League.

Training facilities
The Kings' training facility is located at the Xinzhuang Gymnasium. The Kings used to practice at the HTC headquarters sports court.

Notable players
;;Local players
*  Chien You-Che (簡祐哲) – Chinese Taipei national team player
*  Quincy Davis (戴維斯) – Chinese Taipei national team player, SBL Finals MVP (2018), SBL MVP (2012)
*  Hung Chih-Shan (洪至善) – Chinese Taipei national team player
*  Lee Kai-Yan (李愷諺) – Chinese Taipei national team player, PLG Finals MVP (2024)
*  Lin Chin-Pang (林金榜) – Chinese Taipei national team player
*  Lin Yan-Ting (林彥廷) – Chinese Taipei national team player
*  Lu Cheng-Ju (呂政儒) – Chinese Taipei national team player, SBL MVP (2018)
*  Su Shih-Hsuan (蘇士軒) – Chinese Taipei national team player
*  Yang Chin-Min (楊敬敏) – Chinese Taipei national team player, SBL Finals MVP (2011), PLG MVP (2022, 2023)
;;Heritage players
*  Jeremy Lin – NBA player, TPBL MVP (2025), TPBL Finals MVP (2025)
;;Asian import players
*  Sani Sakakini – Palestine national team player
;;BCL Asia players
*  Michael Efevberha – Nigeria national team player
;;Import players
*  Chaundee Brown – NBA player
*  Austin Daye – NBA player
*  Chris Johnson – NBA player, PLG Finals MVP (2023)
*  DeAndre Liggins – NBA player
*  Chris McCullough – NBA player
*  Tony Mitchell – NBA player
*  Byron Mullens – NBA player
*  Jason Washburn – Bulgaria national team player
*  Thomas Welsh – NBA player
